meanings.definition: To drink alcohol, especially in small quantities
meanings.sent1: After work, he tippled a glass of wine to relax.
meanings.sent2: She tippled a sip of beer at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat tippled the spilled beer from the floor.
meanings.sent4: The flowers seemed to have tippled the raindrops from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old man tippled his evening drink with a contented sigh.

meanings.definition: To consume alcoholic beverages in a social setting
meanings.sent1: At the wedding, guests tippled champagne to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: They tippled cocktails while chatting at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The birds tippled the nectar together in harmony.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to tipple the moonlight in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The friends tippled their drinks merrily at the pub.

meanings.definition: To indulge in drinking alcohol, often to excess
meanings.sent1: He tippled too much whiskey and felt unwell the next day.
meanings.sent2: She tippled excessively at the party and regretted it later.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tippled the fermented fruit and stumbled around comically.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to tipple the rain relentlessly on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The group tippled all night, laughing and singing loudly.
